description:
Kwoniella pini CBS 10737 is a species of yeast that belongs to the genus Kwoniella. This genus is classified within the phylum Basidiomycota, which encompasses fungi that produce spores on club-shaped structures called basidia.

Kwoniella pini CBS 10737 was first isolated from pine bark in Germany. It is a unicellular, asexual fungus that reproduces through budding, a process where new cells emerge from the parent cell. The cells are typically round or oval in shape.

Genetically, Kwoniella pini CBS 10737 is characterized by its unique ribosomal DNA sequence, which differentiates it from other Kwoniella species. It is considered a member of the Tremellales order within the Tremellomycetes class of Basidiomycota.

The ecological role of Kwoniella pini CBS 10737 in its natural habitat, pine bark, is not fully understood, but it is believed to be involved in the decomposition of woody plant material, contributing to nutrient cycling in forest ecosystems.
